message.content:
I need you to create 6 shell scripts for Android development workflow. Please create these files exactly as specified:

**FILE: scripts/setup-session-device.sh**
```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Architecture detection
if [[ $(uname -m) == "arm64" ]]; then
    IMG="system-images;android-34;google_apis;arm64-v8a"
else
    IMG="system-images;android-34;google_apis;x86_64"
fi

# Create session-specific emulator
SESSION_NAME="claude-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)"
EMULATOR_NAME="test-$SESSION_NAME"

echo "Creating emulator: $EMULATOR_NAME"
avdmanager create avd -n "$EMULATOR_NAME" -k "$IMG" -d "pixel_4" -f

# Find free port function
pick_port() {
  for p in $(seq 5554 2 5584); do
    if ! (adb devices | grep -q "emulator-$p"); then
      echo $p; return
    fi
  done
  echo "No free emulator port" >&2; exit 1
}

EMU_PORT=$(pick_port)

# Generate random ADB server port (macOS compatible)
ADB_PORT=$((5037 + RANDOM % 1000))
export ADB_SERVER_PORT=$ADB_PORT

echo "Starting emulator on port: $EMU_PORT"
echo "ADB server port: $ADB_SERVER_PORT"

# Start ADB server for this session
adb start-server

# Start emulator
emulator -avd "$EMULATOR_NAME" -port "$EMU_PORT" \
  -no-snapshot-save -no-boot-anim -noaudio -wipe-data &

# Wait and set target
export ANDROID_SERIAL="emulator-$EMU_PORT"

# Wait for device to be fully ready
echo "Waiting for emulator to boot completely..."
adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" wait-for-device

# Wait for system services to be ready
timeout=120
while [ $timeout -gt 0 ]; do
    if adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell service list | grep -q "package" && \
       adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell getprop sys.boot_completed | grep -q "1"; then
        echo "Android boot completed"
        break
    fi
    echo "Waiting for Android to finish booting... ($timeout seconds remaining)"
    sleep 3
    timeout=$((timeout - 3))
done

# Additional wait for package manager
echo "Waiting for package manager to be ready..."
timeout=60
while [ $timeout -gt 0 ]; do
    if adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell pm list packages >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "Package manager ready"
        break
    fi
    echo "Waiting for package manager... ($timeout seconds remaining)"
    sleep 2
    timeout=$((timeout - 2))
done

echo "Device ready: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
echo "To use this device, run: export ANDROID_SERIAL=$ANDROID_SERIAL"
echo "To clean up, run: scripts/cleanup-session-device.sh $EMULATOR_NAME $ANDROID_SERIAL"

# Save session info for cleanup
echo "$EMULATOR_NAME:$ANDROID_SERIAL" > .claude-session-device
FILE: scripts/get-app-id.sh
bash#!/bin/bash
# Extract applicationId from build.gradle.kts
grep "applicationId = " app/build.gradle.kts | sed 's/.*applicationId = "\(.*\)".*/\1/'
FILE: scripts/start-session.sh
bash#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
echo "üöÄ Starting Claude Code session..."
./scripts/setup-session-device.sh
export ANDROID_SERIAL=$(cat .claude-session-device | cut -d: -f2)
echo "‚úÖ Session ready! Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
echo "üí° To use: export ANDROID_SERIAL=$ANDROID_SERIAL"
FILE: scripts/quick-test.sh
bash#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
if [[ ! -f .claude-session-device ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå No active session. Run ./scripts/start-session.sh first"
    exit 1
fi

export ANDROID_SERIAL=$(cat .claude-session-device | cut -d: -f2)
echo "üî® Quick build and test on device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"

./gradlew assembleDebug
APPID=$(scripts/get-app-id.sh)
adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" install -r app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk
MAIN=$(adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell cmd package resolve-activity --brief \
    -a android.intent.action.MAIN -c android.intent.category.LAUNCHER -p "$APPID" | tail -n1)
adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell am start -W -n "$MAIN"
echo "‚úÖ Quick test completed!"
FILE: scripts/end-session.sh
bash#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail
echo "üßπ Ending Claude Code session..."
./scripts/cleanup-session-device.sh
echo "‚úÖ Session ended and cleaned up"
FILE: scripts/test-workflow.sh
bash#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "üöÄ Testing Claude Code Workflow"
echo "üì± Starting session device..."
./scripts/setup-session-device.sh

export ANDROID_SERIAL=$(cat .claude-session-device | cut -d: -f2)
echo "üì± Using device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"

echo "üî® Building app..."
./gradlew assembleDebug

echo "üì¶ Installing app..."
APPID=$(scripts/get-app-id.sh)
adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" install -r app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk

echo "üöÄ Launching app..."
MAIN=$(adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell cmd package resolve-activity --brief \
    -a android.intent.action.MAIN -c android.intent.category.LAUNCHER -p "$APPID" | tail -n1)

if [[ -n "$MAIN" && "$MAIN" != "No"* ]]; then
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell am start -W -n "$MAIN"
    echo "‚úÖ App launched successfully: $MAIN"
    
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell screencap -p /sdcard/success.png
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" pull /sdcard/success.png ./workflow_test_success.png
    echo "‚úÖ Screenshot saved: workflow_test_success.png"
else
    echo "‚ùå Failed to launch app"
    exit 1
fi

echo "üßπ Cleaning up..."
./scripts/cleanup-session-device.sh
echo "üéâ Workflow test completed successfully!"
After creating these files, make them all executable with:
bashchmod +x scripts/*.sh
These scripts work together for Android emulator session management. The setup-session-device.sh creates isolated emulators, quick-test.sh does fast build/test cycles, and cleanup-session-device.sh (which already exists) cleans up resources.

echo "üì¶ Installing app..."
APPID=$(scripts/get-app-id.sh)
adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" install -r app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk

echo "üöÄ Launching app..."
MAIN=$(adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell cmd package resolve-activity --brief \
    -a android.intent.action.MAIN -c android.intent.category.LAUNCHER -p "$APPID" | tail -n1)

if [[ -n "$MAIN" && "$MAIN" != "No"* ]]; then
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell am start -W -n "$MAIN"
    echo "‚úÖ App launched successfully: $MAIN"
    
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" shell screencap -p /sdcard/success.png
    adb -s "$ANDROID_SERIAL" pull /sdcard/success.png ./workflow_test_success.png
    echo "‚úÖ Screenshot saved: workflow_test_success.png"
else
    echo "‚ùå Failed to launch app"
    exit 1
fi

echo "üßπ Cleaning up..."
./scripts/cleanup-session-device.sh
echo "üéâ Workflow test completed successfully!"

This happened even > when the layout was calculated correctly, pointing to a resource-loading > issue, not a layout calculation one. > > Solution: > Implemented an image preloading and predecoding strategy within the > collapsible content's JavaScript. This mirrors the proven pattern > already used for switchable infoboxes. > > On page load, the script now: > 1. Finds all images within any collapsible element. > 2. Gathers all unique  and  URLs. > 3. Creates  objects and calls  on them. > > This ensures all images are downloaded and decoded into memory before > the user can expand the content, making the first expansion as smooth > as all subsequent ones and completely eliminating the jank.
